/wiki/2004_European_Judo_Championships: The 2004 European Judo Championships were the 15th edition of the European Judo Championships , and were held in Bucharest , Romania from 14 May to 16 May 2004 .
/wiki/2004_European_Judo_Open_Championsh: The 2004 European Judo Open Championships were the 1st edition of the European Judo Open Championships , and were held in Budapest , Hungary on 4 December 2004 . The European Judo Open Championships was staged because the open class event had been dropped from the European Judo Championships program from 2004 . Unlike the regular European Judo Championships , several competitors from each country are allowed to enter .
/wiki/2003_European_Judo_Championships: The 2003 European Judo Championships were the 14th edition of the European Judo Championships , and were held in Düsseldorf , Germany from 16 May to 18 May 2003 .
/wiki/2002_European_Judo_Championships: The 2002 European Judo Championships were the 13th edition of the European Judo Championships , and were held in Maribor , Slovenia from 16 May to 19 May 2002 .
/wiki/Judo_at_the_1996_Summer_Olympics: This page shows the final results of the Judo Competition at the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta .
/wiki/1996_European_Judo_Championships: The 1996 European Judo Championships were the 7th edition of the European Judo Championships , and were held in The Hague , Netherlands on 19 May 1996 .
/wiki/1995_European_Judo_Championships: The 1995 European Judo Championships were the 6th edition of the European Judo Championships , and were held in Birmingham , England on 13 and 14 May 1995 .
/wiki/1993_World_Judo_Championships: The 1993 World Judo Championships were the 18th edition of the World Judo Championships , and were held in Hamilton , Canada from September 30 to October 3 , 1993 .
/wiki/1993_European_Judo_Championships: The 1993 European Judo Championships were the 4th edition of the European Judo Championships , and were held in Athens , Greece on 2 May 1993 .
/wiki/Judo_at_the_1992_Summer_Olympics: The Judo competition at the 1992 Summer Olympics was contested in fourteen weight classes , seven each for men and women . The seven men 's weight classes continued to be those first used in 1980 . This was the first Olympic competition to award medals to women judoka ; women competed in 1988 as a demonstration sport .
/wiki/1992_European_Judo_Championships: The 1992 European Judo Championships were the 3rd edition of the European Judo Championships , and were held in Paris , France on 10 May 1992 .
